EXECUTIVE SUMMARY FOR RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN OF NORTH WATER TREATMENT PLANT: 



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

It is the policy of the Archer Daniels Midland Company (ADM) North Water Treatment Plant, Decatur IL to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Program in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68.  The objective is to prevent a release of chlorine and to minimize the potential impact to ADM's employees, the public and the environment.  This objective will be accomplished by using the elements of process safety management, for example standard operating procedures, preventative maintenance program, employee training, and emergency response activities coordinated with local responders.



FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

ADM North Water Treatment Plant is located in the north east side of the city of Decatur, IL and on the north end of Lake Decatur.  The facility purifies water from Lake Decatur to provide quality process water for the ADM manufacturing facilities within the Decatur complex.  The plant treats water by lime softening, filtration, and disinfection with chlorine.

Chlorine is the regulated substance that requires a Risk Management Plan (RMP) at this facility. 

The main components of the chlorine disinfection system are a station where one-ton cylinders are transferred between the delivery truck and the chlorine room, a hoist to move the cylinders, and vacuum regulators to inject the chlorine into the water.  All equipment that contains chlorine is enclosed in a room with a monitoring system for detecting leaks. The monitoring system activates local and remote alarms.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

The facility uses the elements of Process Safety Management to control the hazards of using chlorine. The concepts in the prevention program include employee participation, analysis of hazards, operating procedu

res and safe work practices, incident investigation to assign appropriate preventive measures, personnel training, maintenance and mechanical integrity programs, and contractor programs.

All equipment that contains chlorine is enclosed in a room with monitors for detecting leaks. The monitoring system activates local and remote alarms.  The chlorine distribution system operates under vacuum.  

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

The facility had no reportable accidents in the last five years.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

Emergency response at this facility is coordinated with the Decatur Fire Department so that in the event of an accident, immediate emergency response measures will be implemented.  The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan to deal with prevention of and response to accidental releases of hazardous materials.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Recommended actions from the last process hazard analyses have been completed.

ADM will continue to evaluate and implement changes when necessary to improve safety at the North Water Treatment Plant.
